articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanon's Hezbollah said on Wednesday it fired a rocket targeting Mossad spy agency headquarters near Tel Aviv, which it blamed for the assassination of its leaders and the blowing up communications devices used by its members, in a new escalation that moved the arch-foes closer to full-fledged war.
articles.title: Lebanon's Hezbollah says it launched rocket targeting Mossad base near Tel Aviv

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump will hold a rally on Oct. 5 in Butler, Pennsylvania, the town where he was shot in an assassination attempt, his campaign said in a statement on Wednesday.
articles.title: Trump to hold rally in Butler, site of July assassination attempt

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia has established a weapons programme in China to develop and produce long-range attack drones for use in the war against Ukraine, according to two sources from a European intelligence agency and documents reviewed by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Russia has secret war drones project in China, intel sources say

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Laila Bassam
articles.description: The United States is spearheading a new diplomatic effort to end hostilities in both Gaza and Lebanon, linking the two conflicts as part of a single initiative, six sources familiar with the initiative told Reuters.
articles.title: US leads new effort to end hostilities in Lebanon and Gaza, sources say

articles.author: Vladimir Soldatkin, Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Putin said that proposals had been made to change Russia's nuclear doctrine.
articles.title: Putin issues nuclear warning to the West over strikes on Russia from Ukraine

articles.author: Mike Stone, Patricia Zengerle, Phil Stewart
articles.description: The United States plans to announce more than $8 billion worth of military assistance for Ukraine on Thursday during Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy's visit to Washington, two U.S. officials said on Wednesday.
articles.title: US prepares $8 billion in arms aid packages for Zelenskiy visit, sources say

articles.author: David Alire Garcia, Belén Carreño
articles.description: A fight dating back more than five centuries reemerged on Wednesday as Mexico's incoming president defended a decision to not invite the Spanish king to her inauguration next week after the monarch declined to apologize for colonial-era abuses.
articles.title: Mexico snubs Spanish king as spat over colonial past flares up

articles.author: Bo Erickson, Moira Warburton
articles.description: Republican U.S. Representative Clay Higgins faced a call for censure on Wednesday for a repeating false claims about Haitian immigrants in Springfield, Ohio, that the head of the Congressional Black Caucus denounced as inciting hate.
articles.title: Republican US lawmaker Higgins under fire for false claim about Haitian Americans

articles.author: Jessie Pang
articles.description: A Hong Kong court is due to sentence two former editors on Thursday who have been found guilty of sedition after publishing articles about the national security crackdown in the city under China - a ruling that has prompted an international outcry.
articles.title: Hong Kong court to sentence two former editors found guilty of sedition in landmark case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A raging wildfire filled Ecuador's capital of Quito with smoke and threatened homes on Tuesday as authorities rushed to control the blaze at a time when a historic drought has stretched resources and patience.
articles.title: Wildfire rages in Ecuador's drought-stricken capital
